file_content.text: [The writing carved into this stone is almost illegible with age.]
[The more you examine it, the stronger your intuition becomes: the first blade you seek is here.]
[Drawing on your knowledge of ancient texts, you puzzle out a translation. The words "first blade" are still readable.]
[Your years of travel and experiencing new languages help you comprehend it. The words "first blade" are still readable.]
Show respect. You stand before greatness.
The first blade. I guard. It rests with the ashes of its maker. The Weapon Master.
I don't know the title. Who was he?
The Weapon Master?
He saw Jedi as warriors. Not only philosophers. Armed them. Protected them.
I must take the first blade. The Jedi have need of it again.
I've come for the first blade.
Why bother protecting this antique?
Strange to guard it.
The first blade. First Jedi weapon. From this beginning, lightsabers came.
Millennia pass. Only hilt of first blade remains. Only disturbed once.
"Rajivari" came. He proved worthy. Permitted to take the hilt. Later, returned it.
Why would Master Rajivari take the hilt and then bring it back?
He returned it?
Not my concern.
Perhaps I could do as Rajivari did.
"Proved worthy," you say.
Enough history lessons. I came for the first blade, or whatever's left of it.
Just give me the hilt.
To take the hilt, prove worthy. The philosophy of Jedi combat. Show understanding.
The Weapon Master left challenges. Here, in Kaleth. Training droids. To test his students.
Find them. Prevail. The hilt of the first blade waits.
